title: Last month was the hottest August ever recorded, as year of climate extremes continues
description: August was the hottest August on Earth, according to climate data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration going back 174 years.

title: JPMorgan Chase to offer online payroll services as it steps up fight with Square, PayPal
description: JPMorgan is fighting for the loyalty of American customers as fintech players like PayPal and Square morph into do-everything providers.

title: More companies, especially airlines, warn higher costs will eat into profits
description: UPS and airlines are digesting big new labor deals, while Hollywood and the auto industry are at odds with unions.

title: Air Force chief sounds off on Musk's Ukraine decision, tensions with China and the future of war
description: Air Force Secretary Frank Kendall spoke to CNBC about the use of SpaceX's Starlink in Ukraine, a potential conflict between the U.S. and China, and AI.

title: Hunter Biden indicted on firearms charges
description: Hunter Biden, son of President Joe Biden, was indicted on three criminal counts related to his possession of a firearm, a court filing showed.

title: Everything you need to know about UAW's targeted strike plans – and possible lockouts
description: The UAW union is ready to conduct targeted strikes against the Detroit automakers if the sides fail to reach new deals by 11:59 p.m. ET.

title: Manhattan median rent remains at record high of nearly $4,400 a month
description: Brokers said buyers who would normally be looking to purchase apartments are choosing to rent for now given high interest rates.

title: Caesars paid millions in ransom to cybercrime group prior to MGM hack
description: There have now been two highly disruptive attacks on the gaming industry in a matter of weeks.

title: Arm climbs 17% in Nasdaq debut after pricing IPO at $51 a share
description: Arm Holdings, the chip design firm, has begun trading on the Nasdaq in a long-anticipated IPO at a $54 billion valuation.

title: SoftBank's Masayoshi Son says AI-fueled technology can surpass human intelligence 'big time'
description: AI is capable of helping solve the world's biggest problems and could potentially surpass the intelligence of humans, says SoftBank's Masayoshi Son.

title: Arm China 'doing well,' CEO says, even as SoftBank's Masa Son reduces China exposure
description: Arm's China subsidiary is "doing well" with strong potential in data center and automotive applications, despite the geopolitical tumult of the last few years, Arm Holdings CEO Rene Haas said.

title: Mindless scrolling hurts productivity. Here's what you can do, says bestselling ‘Atomic Habits’ author
description: Mindless phone scrolling prevents us from "performing at a high level," but there are ways to dial back such distractions, said author James Clear.

title: U.S. crude oil prices top $90 a barrel for the first time since November 2022
description: Oil prices jumped, with U.S. crude topping $90 a barrel, as expectations of a tighter supply grew.

title: ‘Extremely risky’: OPEC criticizes IEA forecast that fossil fuel demand will peak before 2030
description: OPEC on Thursday sharply criticized the IEA's forecast that demand for fossil fuels like coal, oil and gas will peak before the end of the decade.

title: European Central Bank hikes rates to record level as inflation risks outweigh economic gloom
description: Economists and analysts were divided over whether the doves or hawks in Frankfurt would win out in September.

title: Arm's biggest customers are also backing a rival chip design — here's what you need to know
description: Arm priced its shares at $51 for its U.S. IPO but it has warned on a number of risks including rising competition from a rival architecture called RISC-V.

title: Italy's possible withdrawal from China's Belt and Road program could pave the way for future exits
description: At a time of shifting geopolitical alignments that's fragmenting the world's economy, Rome is coming under pressure to recast its relationship with Beijing to placate its western allies.

title: Ethereum co-founder says 'clear heads will prevail' in the SEC's legal battles with crypto firms
description: Ethereum co-founder Joseph Lubin said that the U.S. will see that blockchain and cryptocurrencies are "aligned with the philosophies of the country."

title: F1 in Singapore: McLaren's Lando Norris says track is 'tough' but eyes top spot this weekend
description: Norris is confident of his prospects in the Lion City, after a slew of upgrades to the team's MCL60 car resulted in vastly improved results in the second half of the season.

title: Language at work is becoming more casual — thanks to Gen Z
description: Office communication, including emails, are becoming less formal, and Gen Z is leading the change, research by Barclays LifeSkills found.

title: China auto industry body 'firmly opposes' EU probe on Chinese EV subsidies, urges objectivity
description: The European Commission unexpectedly launched an investigation Wednesday on the level of state subsidies that benefits China's electric vehicle makers.

title: Shipping giant Maersk unveils 'trendsetter' green vessel as it aims to be carbon neutral by 2040
description: Shipping giant Maersk on Thursday presented its first container vessel moved with green methanol.

title: Taiwan slams Elon Musk, says it's 'not for sale' nor part of China
description: Taiwan is not for sale, and neither is it part of China, said Taiwan foreign affairs ministry, in a rebuke to Elon Musk.

title: 'Just a temporary blip’: Chinese travelers will be back, says Banyan Tree founder
description: Banyan Tree Holdings founder Ho Kwon Ping said his company — which operates more than 60 hotels — is seeing “Chinese tourism coming back quite strongly.”

title: CNBC Daily Open: August’s CPI report isn’t as bad as it seems
description: At first glance, August’s CPI report seems bad news. But look more closely and you’ll find things aren’t as terrifying as they seem.
